Report
Resident
2016 - 2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/10/2017
I have lived here for almost 14 months and have been having consistent problems with management and my upstairs neighbors. We live on the first floor and the third floor neighbors throw down onto our patio and surrounding grass: red cups filled with dog dog feces, used condoms, vomit, trash, glass beer bottles which break all over my patio, chicken bones, cooking grease, and then the ants that swarm all over my patio and the food remains are disgusting. There is always fast food garbage all over the neighborhood. I don't feel safe walking my dogs outside because I'm afraid they are going to step in broken glass or try to eat someone's disgusting chicken bones that were thrown into the grass. The management has done nothing about our upstairs neighbors who constantly throw parties on the weekends and results in the refuse all over our outside area. The parties contributes to the lack of parking in the neighborhood and I have to park a 5 minute walk from my apartment because the lot is full of non-residents. They also put up more "reserved spaces" that you have to pay extra for after we moved in so parking is even more scarce. There are also sometimes abandoned, tagless cars in the parking spots which sit there for weeks before they get towed. Then just last night I heard the upstairs neighbors yelling outside. I have also seen cops in the neighborhood arresting people for dealing drugs. The management doesn't seem to think that the deplorable behavior of our neighbors warrants any disciplinary action, and had made no moves to evict the people that are causing problems for us and the people around them. We have contacted both the office and corporate multiple times and they do not take us seriously or address our complaints. They want you to live in squalor along with the trashy people who think they can do whatever they want without repercussions.

Report
Resident
2015 - 2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/02/2017
Please dont be fooled by the 4 and 5 star reviews,. I believe these people dont really live here, or were paid to make their review. Fist off, this place over charges you on your rent. They charge you a utility fee, which I dont even know what that is. They charge you twice for trash. The first charge is $30 for valet trash, not sure what the other $9 charge is for. They wont let you get your own washer and dryer, you have to use theirs. The place is infested with roaches, mice, lizards, and snakes. Parking is horrible and they want to charge you $80-150 to rent a carport or garage that probably wont even be near your apartment. Maintenance sucks, they take forever to fix whatever issue you have and when they do, they half --- or dont do it at all. Walls are super thin, I know when my neighbor takes a shower, uses the bathroom, coughs, watches tv, sings, washes clothes, uses the dishwasher, everything!! Seriously considering breaking my lease. There is mold in the apartments and they make you sign a Mold addendum so that they wont get in trouble if you get sick and die. They try to get you by having the grounds look all nice, so dont be fooled. Stay away from this place!!

Report
Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/17/2017
I am a college kid currently interning at a company in RTP down the street. I was upset when I found out my AC was not working when I came home from work, and submitted a request to the office. I called a couple of times, and staff was good at understanding my issue and gave me fans for a couple of days until the AC is fixed, which helped alleviate my stress while it is being fixed. They will be sending out service maintenance soon. READ THE CONTRACT CAREFULLY. The contract is for all apartments in North Carolina, and requires a 60 day notice prior to move out, and has a monthly auto-lease clause if you do not specify your move-out date. My roommates and I glossed over this part, and actually almost had to pay for an extra month, totaling to almost $1800 extra. Fortunately for us, the staff at Edinborough were understanding of our issue and fixed our move-out date to the correct date.

Report
Resident
2015 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/25/2017
I moved into one of the renovated homes and it's beautiful. With hardwood floors, brushed nickel finishes, and updated appliances, it offers everything I wanted without the higher monthly rents that I found at other newer communities in the area. It's an older but quaint community with a great location! Tucked away from the hustle and bustle of RTP and just minutes away from the airport, shopping, and plenty of restaurants. The office team is awesome! No matter what I need, they are always there to assist. The maintenance team is great too! My requests have been completed in a timely manner and completed on the first attempt. I've seen complaints about noise but it's an apartment- you're going to hear noise but it's nothing that's out of control. Overall, my experience has been very positive and I would highly recommend moving here!

Report
Resident
2013 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/08/2017
My family has lived at Edinborough at the Park, for going on 4 years. With in this time we have seen a lot of people come and go, from employees to residents. The property under the old management used to have functions for the residents, like pool parties, food truck Wednesday, little trinkets with a card to wish you a happy birthday!! Over the last year there were 2-3, functions for the community. So that's a huge cut back from how the residents were brought together... We have a new crew of maintenance so I won't speak on their service just yet. All reviews about past issues with the office staff and maintenance are fairly true, I can attest to that.. We had to wait a week for a new furnace during the winter, the hot water heater kept going out for months before it finally went completely out... With everything being pretty new (new management, new maintenance workers) the staff has been wonderful to my family!! My reason for writing my review today is because, it's been well overdue!! Also manly because I received a call from the office today and I'm taking my experience with the new staff as a good sign that Edinborough at the Park, values their residents!! In return I wanted to thank the new staff by writing a review for new potential residents!!! Everyone's experience will be different from one another's, but overall my experience has been a good one!!

2015 - 2016 Not Recommended Reviewed 11/21/2016
Where do I even begin?? First, do not be fooled by the overly nice, more than willing to "help" staff in the office. They do everything possible to rope you into leasing at this property. After doing some extensive research my husband and I decided to tour this property, mainly because it was advertised as a gated, secure community. We saw two different floor plans and settled on a newly renovated first floor apartment. HUGE MISTAKE. Within days of touring we came back to sign our lease and noticed all the gates were being removed. Apparently our "gated community" was no longer going to be so. All security gates and security doors were being dismantled. We were told by a staff member it was because the new owners of the property were tired of paying to replace or repair gates that were being hit by residents, so to cut costs they decided to remove all the gates. Huge red flag, but we continued on. Our leasing agent was going over costs with us when we noticed that there were fees for LITERALLY EVERYTHING!! And you cannot opt out of ANY of them! A washer and dryer was placed in the unit that we wanted, and we were told they absolutely would NOT remove them. So tack on $35 a month for that. Valet Trash service that they absolutely will NOT remove, add on another $30 a month for that. OH! But then they charge you another $9 fee for using the dumpster as well, even though you have the forced valet trash service and don't use the dumpster! Absolutely will NOT remove that fee either. Add on pet rent, water (which by the way is OUTRAGEOUS because EVERYTHING in the apartment leaks!) and you have over $100-$145 MORE added to your base rent. Moving on from the fees, the neighborhood is like a demilitarized zone! So many thugs, drug dealers, unattended children, etc. Our upstairs neighbors sound like they are coming through the ceiling at least 3 or 4 times a day, and our downstairs neighbors sound like they are running a nightclub out of their apartment. Then there's the constant overpowering scent of weed smoking, screaming and fighting, drug deals in the parking lots, the list goes on and on. After many, MANY, MAAAAANNNNNNYYYYYY complaints to the office all they have to say is that we either need to talk to the neighbors ourselves and complain or call the police. I can tell you that this is BY FAR the absolute WORST place that I have ever had the displeasure of living. PLEASE do yourself a favor and just don't even look here!!

Report
Resident
2013 - 2016 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/04/2016
I was very happy my first 1.5 years at this complex, but the last 1.5 years were awful and I could not wait to leave. First, the increase in rent from years 2-3 for a 1 bedroom increased by $60/month. They even increased the pet rent from $15 to $20/month. I noticed an increased police presence in the complex. Beware that your lease says maintenance can enter your apt without asking you - many times they give you some warning, but other times no. There is an increasing problem at the pool with people throwing massive parties and taking over the grills and chairs - most of the people don't even live there. I have also had problems with older appliances (i.e. dishwasher) not working - I asked maintenance to come look at it twice, and they said it was my own fault for putting in hand soap (which I never did). As many others have noted, there are a lot of hidden fees. This includes: $8.25/month for trash service, $30/month for Valet trash (which you cannot opt out of), $3.75/month utility admin fees, $2.50/month for pest control, and if you decide to "rent" a washer/dryer, it is an extra $35/month. With a pet it is an additional $15/month. Therefore, on top of base rent it could cost almost $100/month extra, not including water, electricity, and energy. I have had horrible neighbors constantly blasting music enough to vibrate my walls and/or very early in the morning, throwing basketballs at the area below my window at 7am on weekend mornings, kids running around unsupervised through the parking lot, packages stolen from my doorstep, and many apts are under renovations so be prepared to listen to work being done for the next few years. I was happy there, and now am happier I moved out.

Verified Resident
2014 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/23/2016
Edinborough at the Park is a wonderful place. I will say that the maintenance team is a bit lazy and doesn't do a great job with fixing things. For example, we had a mouse in the fireplace and they placed sticky traps and I had to call several times to get them to come get the traps. The back door weather stripping came off and when they replaced it the door became nearly impossible to open (even the 200 pound maintenance guy had to put all of his weight behind the door to open it, how do you think the 130 pound woman that lives there will fare?). Silly things like that. But the people that work at the front office were always incredibly nice and easy to work with. Be careful on the move out, there are a lot of move out notification windows that you will not be reminded of and you will be forced to rent for longer than you want. So make sure you know when to put in notice of leave, cancel renting garages/carports, etc. Also, the neighborhood isn't bad, but people that left things in plain sight in their car, did wake up to find windows busted out of their cars (things like computer bags and electronics mostly). There were 3 car break ins in my corner of the lot in my 2 year tenor here. Just be mindful of what you leave in your car.

I have lived here for over 3 years and last year upgraded to a bigger place. I chose to stay at Edinborough when I needed more room because I have absolutely loved the experience! I have access to 3 pools, including an indoor (laps in the winter, love it!). The staff in the office and also the maintenance staff have always been great! The office staff knows my name and always have a smile. Maintenance answers calls lightning fast and when my air conditioner leaked they were at my place with a fan and tools within 5 mins. The location is unbelievable, 5 mins to Raleigh and less than 15 mins to Chapel Hill. Right next to 40 and 147. The nature area surrounding the complex prevents any highway noise from getting in and the complex is always peaceful and quiet. I would say any noise heard by neighbors is a normal apt living level of noise. There is a trash fee; however, no more than any other complex and I would pay double for the luxury of never having to lug bags of trash to the dumpster. 5 days a week of door to door service! The price for the square footage can't be beat and the apartments are clean and comfortable. And I can't put a price on feeling safe in a neighborhood. I have recommended the complex to others when asked about good places to live. I am a single, young, professional and I do appreciate that there are not a lot of children in the area. This helps with the lower level of noise. Overall, this place has been a safe, comfortable, enjoyable home to me for over 3 years and I would highly recommend this to others who are clean, respectable, and looking to have a pleasant home life. C. Kahanic

Resident
2014 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/20/2015
I've lived here for about 9 months now, and as with any place it has its pros and cons. The apartments have a nice layout. This is the largest two bedroom I've seen in the RTP area. There have been no issues with bugs. The maintenance staff is friendly and usually prompt. They have an indoor and outdoor pool. But there is no playground. Sound can carry in these apartments. I've lived in several complexes in the area, and I've heard my neighbors the most in this one. That might just be due to noisy neighbors here compared with other complexes as well. For the square footage we have, prices are very reasonable compared with other complexes near by. Overall, I would recommend Edinborough.

Resident
2013 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 02/16/2015
I have lived here for two years and cannot wait until my lease is up in April. I have had one issue after the other with the leasing office. They appear to be helpful and friendly upon moving in and then once you do, it goes downhill from there. My neighbors and I are experiencing an excessive amount of ants. There is mold on the windows and throughout the apartment. Water leaks through the ceilings and windows. The appliances are dated and are constantly needing fixing. There are so many different types of bugs that come up through the carpet and die. For five months, I've seen thousands of ants off and on consistently every week. They've been in my bathrooms (tubs and shower), cabinets, underneath the sinks, in the oven, on the walls, as well as in my linens in my laundry room. Its been a huge pain dealing with this as the leasing consultants including BOTH managers have tried to downplay this issue. They recently stated that the problem should be resolved after supposedly doing something different with treatment. Every Friday, Frye Exterminators have come out to spray my apartment. I have two small kids whom I have expressed concern about in regards to treatment measures. It has been so inconvenient and stressful dealing with this. They've told me things like, "This is normal." They've also stated that the ants are just trying to find some place warm to go. I don't give a care about why they are here! Their job is to get rid of them by hiring the right individuals to do so. FIVE months is way to long to be dealing with a pest infestation; however, the expect me to continue to pay my rent on time to them???? I have never lived somewhere so uncomfortable before in my life. I pay far too much rent to deal with this mess. They don't live this way, so they shouldn't expect their relatives to either. They make sure that the outside appearance is up too par...maybe even a little too much. This appeals to potential residents and once they move in, they see things differently. Four of my neighbors have bailed before their leases have even been up. DO NOT COME HERE!!! There are break-ins and crime that they won't acknowledge when you bring it to their attention. They pretend to know nothing when in fact the police are required to report these reported incidents to the leasing office upon filing reports on behalf of the residents!!! Why wouldn't you want your residents to be safe and send out email correspondence or gathering tenants for meetings to discuss these types of things? I've resided in other places that have done just that!

Bohmac 06/21/2014

There are a lot of fees but they are all presented upfront and most are included in the quoted rent. For example, the valet trash and washer dryer fees are part of the quoted rent prices online. The pesticide and trash disposal fees are added extra to the prices you see online. As part of my rent special, I had the app fees put towards my first months rent. I think they try to be more reasonable to their prospective renters than you are letting on.

While I never moved into Edinborough at the Park, I have had a good experience with them. Unfortunately, after my brother and I signed a lease, the current tenants decided not to move after all. After the staff at Edinborough (especially Nate who was more than helpful through the entire process and kept me updated regularly) tried to find an acceptable alternative for us, we realized that the apartment we wanted would not be coming available before we had to move. They refunded both of our application fees and our administration fees because of the difficulty we had. I'm sure a lot of places would have just written us off once the current tenants decided not to leave, but Nate was not willing to give up that easily. I'm very disappointed that we couldn't move in, but pleased with how the situation was handled.

Report
Resident
2010 - 2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/07/2013
I truly have enjoyed my stay here at Edinborough at the Park. My neighbors are courteous and quiet, rarely is there any loud music blaring through the complex, and the environment overall is pretty safe (aside from a few random car break-ins over the past 3 years). Our primary reason for moving is to get our child into a better school district zone. The rent has increased quite a bit each renewal period but we did get a pretty good deal when we first moved here so we definitely felt we got our money worth overall. The increase in the valet trash service does seem unjustifiable compared to what some other places are charging for the same service. However, we feel this way due to the fact we live near the trash compactor and can easily take our trash out ourselves instead of paying for the service. But it is mandatory so what can you do? Take it or find another place. Parking is pretty subjective depending on what part of the community you live. In my vicinity, parking used to be a pretty horrible situation. Nevertheless, in the recent months, things somehow worked out where we did not have to park 2-3 buildings down to get a parking space or park on the curb in risk of getting our car towed at night more than 2-3 nights a week. Now it has been every once in awhile where we have to park far away from our building. Noise like I mentioned has never been an issue since my neighbors have been quite pleasant and respectful of others. The tenants here mostly comprise of professionals, graduate students, and families. Grounds are pretty nice and clean. They just updated the look of the community by giving the buildings a fresh coat of paint. The place definitely looks more lively with the new colors. Safety has rarely been an issue aside from some inadequate lighting when walking toward the fitness center at night. There used to be lights going up the set of stairs toward the leasing office/fitness center a year or two ago but as of yet, they have not been fixed. Nevertheless, I have felt quite safe walking to the mail center and outside my building at night. Construction is fine. Some of the interior has signs of wear and tear but nothing to make the place a deal breaker. Insulation has been an issue especially in the second bedroom where it is challenging to keep at a comfortable temperature compared to the rest of the apartment. The Matisse is very spacious and is an excellent size for my family of three with lots of storage space in the closets, laundry room, and outdoor balcony/patio. I always received compliments on how large to the master bedroom/bathroom are compared to other places. Maintenance has exceeded my expectations. They are expedient in fulfilling work orders and are very personable and down to earth guys. Many times, they have completed work orders within 48 hours of the request and for an emergency such as the A/C not working, they have been at my door within 2 hours of the request. The staff is fine. I rarely have to go to them for anything besides putting in a work order or picking up a package. They seem pretty courteous from my personal experience. I have noticed the management team has changed several times since first moving here but I guess that is not an uncommon thing in the realm of apartment leasing. Overall, compared to other apartments I have seen and from my personal experience, I would recommend this complex to others. I have truly enjoyed my stay here like I said before and will miss the area and the neighbors who have welcomed my family throughout the years. I hope this review is informative to whoever is considering Edinborough at the Park.

I am so happy to be back home at Edinborough at the Park! I truly missed living here the past year! My husband and I have lived here off and on since 2005. His job has moved us around the country a few times. Each time we ended up back in North Carolina we have come back home to Edinborough at the Park! The management team, leasing staff, and maintenance staff are EXCELLENT. Without thinking twice I made one phone call and Nate had us approved and we signed our lease within a few hours! I disagree with some of the reivews that I have read on here. 1. There is ample parking and the parking at the end of Edinborough has drastically improved. 2. The staff does not change very often here. Since we have been here we have only had 2 property managers . That is a plus in my book. The staff knows each resident by their names. What other complex knows their residents by name. Not many. 3. The maintenance team is AMAZING! Mike, Robert, and Keith have been here for a very long time and they are AWESOME at their job. Report
Resident
2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/25/2013
Before I begin this review, I want to make sure that anyone who reads it understands I am not a difficult person. I have lived in student housing, including dorms and apartments. I understand some things come with the territory of living with an apartment. You will hear your neighbors every now and then, because you don't live in a house. There will be maintenance issues. And yet, somehow this apartment complex was still worse than my student apartment in a fairly sketchy neighborhood. DO NOT LIVE HERE. Seriously, stay away. The apartment complex seems nice when you tour it, but living here it's totally different. You can hear EVERYTHING from outside the apartment, and this becomes really annoying as there are loud trucks (as in they don't have a muffler), blasting music, and car alarms going off fairly often. I live above a garage so I knew there would be some noise, but I could also hear my upstairs neighbors more often than not. This includes when they got intimate. Awkward. But surely not as awkward as when the maintenance guys literally show up with a ladder and LEAP (I am not exaggerating) onto your balcony right outside of your window to paint the outside of the apartment or power wash your windows. This would be fine, if I knew when they were coming. There is never any notice, you will just be sitting in your pajamas and suddenly there is someone right on your balcony. I am glad that my apartment has been power washed, but I would love to know that someone will be doing so, rather than opening my blinds and have some man outside staring in. No one knows how to park. Others have mentioned difficulty in finding a parking spot. This is because most of the people living here park over the line, or so close you can't get into the spot. This has happened multiple times. Maybe the parking spots are too small? No idea. This isn't a big deal, just annoying. Speaking of cars, don't expect to ever work on your vehicle in the parking lot. They will tow you and tell you to work on it else where. Management, this is where we live, if my car needs repairs and I can fix it then I am going to fix it where I live. On top of that, the management is very difficult to work with. Don't even think about trying to work out anything with them. Like I said, I have lived in worse neighborhoods and in apartments that aren't built as well. But they have had better management, and these little annoyances I have mentioned above after several months become big issues. Live somewhere where management will listen to you and work with you, not try to suck every little dime away from you. Live somewhere where you won't wake up and have someone on your balcony. And by all means, please just don't try to live here. Not the worst apartment, but you could do better.

And by all means, please just don't try to live here. Not the worst apartment, but you could do better. Read less

I picked this apartment last year as it was quite close to my earlier place of work, and I have no regrets. I would rate it one of the better places I had stayed in the past. Resident
2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/27/2011
We haven't lived here long but we like the complex and the location. The office staff and maintenance crew is friendly and helpful. The issues we have are minor but could be fixed pretty easily. We found this apartment on apartmentguide.com which needs updating as they advertise items which they do not have. For example, they no longer have a playground for children, they no longer have gated access and there is no extra storage, all that they advertise they have. The extra storage that they mention is on the patio/deck but we are told that we cannot store anything in there due to the hot water tank. The rent is a little deceiving as you pay for valet garbage service which is part of the rent however you also have to pay for trash pick up which both seems to be a little excessive. They also throw in a service fee each month however neither the service fee or the additional trash fee is mentioned when signing a lease. I would recommend this apartment complex to anyone moving to the area.

Report
Resident
2008 - 2009 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/19/2009
I lived at Edinborough for a year. We had a basement apartment tucked in the back of the Edinborough section. It was usually pretty quiet, but we had some neighbors who would hang out on their balconies at 3-4am and talk loudly some nights. You would never guess the complex is off the busy Miami Blvd. I took the bus to and from work (UNC), and it was kind of a hassle. The shuttle that stops near Edinborough only comes once every hour, so if you miss one bus, you will be at least one hour late. Also, Edinborough isn't close to much, so if you are looking for a pedestrian-friendly area, this is not it. It's pretty much concrete and open space. We recently moved to Carrboro and are much happier living there. Edinborough is okay if you work at RTP and you don't mind commuting to points of interest on the weekends. Otherwise, it's kind of boring. We never had problems finding a parking spot for building 700E, and I usually felt pretty safe. There was one occurrence that was a little scary: the windows were broken out of some cars one Saturday night. The neighbors were always friendly, and the staff was usually pretty attentive and helpful. One last word of caution: the Durham Post Office handled our change of address terribly both when we moved in and moved out. If you're moving to Edinborough, you will likely need to deal with them. Good luck!

Walls are sort of thin, I hear the neighbors talking through the wall, the guy upstairs peeing in the mornings, but hey, I guess sometimes you gotta go. Traffic on Miami has never been a problem for me in the mornings. I think the price may be a little inflated but it compensates for the ability to have gas water and heating which is a plus. So my lease is almost over and I'm thinking about renewing and I'm reading comments on here about replacing carpet. And to be quite honest, I have vacuumed this carpet on an every 2 day basis and there is nothing wrong with it. If they pull this I will take some sort of legal action. I find pet rent annoying. The pet deposit I can handle. The $15 a month after that, not so much. What am I paying that rent for? So my dog who weighs 12 lbs can sleep at night? I will add that up if they tell me I have to pay for carpet at the end. He is completely housebroken. I will keep everyone posted on what happens. But I just wanted to throw it out there that if you are looking this is an okay place for the price DEPENDING on which building you live in. With that said, if I renew there are certain buildings I will not want to live in. That comes from experience. Read less

Resident
2006 - 2007 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/15/2007
This is a nice apartment complex if you work in the triangle, as you don't have to potentially deal with the disaster that is called I-40. My job is in the heart of the triangle and my morning commutes are usually between 10 to 15 minutes. Be aware that pulling across Miami is a serious hassle, and can even be dangerous. Sometimes I will just turn out and go down to do a U-turn rather than trying to make it across.<br><br>The walls here are paper thin, literally. I can hear my neighbors singing in the shower, doing things that couples do, walking around at 3am, etc. Odors also seem to be a problem, as they seep right through the walls. I have a nice smell of curry baked into everything I own. If you're a car freak, you'll be disappointed to learn that your car wont stay clean here. Between the birds from the forest behind the complex, to the constant morning fog because it lies in a creek basin, your car will get dirty after just a couple days of being washed.<br><br>Also, don't buy into all the amenities advertised. The gym is horrible. The treadmills are about the only pieces of equipment worth anything. There are no free weights. Most of the stuff is broken on a semi-regular basis. Also, the car wash port stays closed about 3/4 of the year. Here it is, mid-May and it still isn't open. Your guess is as good as mine.<br><br>Also be advised that you have to drive 10 or 15 minutes to get to any stores. The convenience stores and gas stations close by usually close by 9 or 10 - including the gas pumps. The closest grocery store is probably Lowes, and it's about 10-15 minutes away in the Brier Creek shopping center (there is also an open-late gas station there, FYI). There are no decent eateries around to speak of, other than the normal fast food chains. Closest ones are also over by Lowes.<br><br>Parking is decent on the Beaver Dam side. It is horrible on the Edinborough side.<br><br>All bad things aside, the complex is relatively quiet aside from the paper-thin walls. You can hear ambient noise from I-40 and Miami, but it isn't too bad. I've had good luck with Graystar so far.<br><br>One of the buildings on the Edinborough side is collapsing into the creek, just FYI. I believe it has been condemned. This is your typical apartment complex folks...buildings constructed as cheaply as possible.<br><br>Bottom line: if you work in the triangle, check this place out. If you're looking for 'luxury living', this isn't the place for you.

Resident
2006 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/19/2006
This is a long one. I'm pretty easy to please, but there are a number of unexpected irritants at this property. Some I should have noticed before moving in, some should have been mentioned when I was looking. Given the price I'm paying for the space I really expect it to be above average for Cary/Morrisville/West Raleigh. It definitely isn't. This is my 8th rental property (6th apartment) in or around RDU. I have never before felt the need to warn people about a property. Here goes:<br><br>Pros: <br>Location.<br>Very convenient for work in RTP.<br>Within 2 miles of a Golds Gym.<br>Approx. 5 minutes from Brier Creek & Southpoint.<br>Large garage.<br>Tile kitchen/laundry area.<br>Dining room large enough for real dining room furniture.<br>Gas stove/oven, water heater.<br>Tilt in windows (easy to clean).<br>9' ceilings<br>Computer nook<br><br>Cons:<br>Outside, my garage floods any time we get a good hard rain (5 times over the summer). It doesn't drain out when the water recedes. It has to be squeegeed out. The back porch has a great view but the noise pollution from the Industrial park (Cree's cooling towers) is 24/7 constant noise, such that no one in my building bothers to even have furniture on their back porch. Fortunately I can only barely hear it when inside (yes, through the windows/walls).<br><br>When they say central air/heat they really mean it. As in the units are in the center of the apartment. I'm a deep sleeper and I've been awakened a few times when my A/C kicked on. The compressor is right behind the intake...right beside the master bedroom. Who designed this? It never even occured to me that this would be a possibility.<br><br>Wood construction. This means that you hear everything that your upstairs neighbors are up to...especially when they are getting started in the morning. I've taken to having a noisy fan in my room to drown out the noises in white noise. Long term that's bad for my hearing, but at least I can sleep until my alarm goes off.<br><br>Noise is, as you can tell, a major problem here. I have upstairs neighbors that aren't helping the situation (who vacuums at 1am?) but that doesn't forgive the complex for cheap construction and other irritating noise factors. How about not mowing the lawn at 8 in the morning? Its just one more thing the fan drowns out.<br><br>Oh, and those gates? During my time here at least one of the gates is broken sometime during every week. It got so bad a that until a few weeks ago they had them all locked open for about two months. Also, they bought the cheapest possible gate system. These aren't even close to security gates. About 5 cars can get through before they close. People sit by the gates and drive in the out gates to get in. Useless for security purposes, so what, pray tell, are they for? It would be better were they removed.<br><br>What else...Oh yeah. The appliances are the cheapest I've ever had. The refridgerator is noisy when running, at least it does stay cold. Too bad it doesn't have any shelves in the freezer. Set at a coldness level of 6/10 my vegetable drawer regularly gets below freezing. Set warmer and it doesn't keep everything properly chilled.<br><br>Build quality in this apartment is abysmal. The floors creak when you walk around, which, given the noise problems, is annoying for the folks downstairs I imagine. The hearth is crooked, as is the fire place (but in the opposite direction). About half of the corners are substantially out of true. I can see light around my front door.<br><br>Remember that huge garage that I mentioned? It has one anemic 60 watt bulb. It feels like a cavern with just that. I installed some large flourescent fixtures and bulbs and now I can actually see. What I discovered when doing this? There's no breaker in my breaker box for any of the garage outlets or lights. Is this even legal? Or are my neighbors paying for that electricity?<br><br>The garage entrance is very narrow. I have about two inches on either side of my mirrors when driving in (granted I have a large vehicle). If you drive a truck or van I hope you have steady hands.<br><br>That computer nook I mentioned in the pros? Yeah, it doesn't have a cable outlet, and the cable company can't add one. Why does that matter? Well, you can't put your cable modem there with your computer...I guess you need either a wireless network or to find a way to run a cable to your computer. I ran the wire underneath my carpet, but I'm betting most people won't be able to manage that.<br><br>Garbage disposal? Well, in theory. Just don't actually try it. Low volume toilets? Well, they are low volume, at the cost of absolutely disgusting...well, you get the point. External storage? Well, yes, but you can't put anything combustible in it, because that is where the water heater is. That rules out cardboard (so, no boxes), paints, cleaners, pretty much anything you might have used it for. Oh, and since we are now sub-metering water they will always need access to the water meter...attached to the water heater. This renders the external storage nearly worthless.
This is a long one. I'm pretty easy to please, but there are a number of unexpected irritants at this property. Some I should have noticed before moving in, some should have been mentioned when I was looking. Given the price I'm paying for the space I really expect it to be above average for Cary/Morrisville/West Raleigh. It definitely isn't. This is my 8th rental property (6th apartment) in or around RDU. I have never before felt the need to warn people about a property. Here goes:<br><br>Pros: <br>Location.<br>Very convenient for work in RTP.<br>Within 2 miles of a Golds Gym.<br>Approx. 5 minutes from Brier Creek & Southpoint.<br>Large garage.<br>Tile kitchen/laundry area.<br>Dining room large enough for real dining room furniture.<br>Gas stove/oven, water heater.<br>Tilt in windows (easy to clean).<br>9' ceilings<br>Computer nook<br><br>Cons:<br>Outside, my garage floods any time we get a good hard rain (5 times over the summer). It doesn't drain out when the water recedes. It has to be squeegeed out. The back porch has a great view but the noise pollution from the Industrial park (Cree's cooling towers) is 24/7 constant noise, such that no one in my building bothers to even have furniture on their back porch. Fortunately I can only barely hear it when inside (yes, through the windows/walls).<br><br>When they say central air/heat they really mean it. As in the units are in the center of the apartment. I'm a deep sleeper and I've been awakened a few times when my A/C kicked on. The compressor is right behind the intake...right beside the master bedroom. Who designed this? It never even occured to me that this would be a possibility.<br><br>Wood construction. This means that you hear everything that your upstairs neighbors are up to...especially when they are getting started in the morning. I've taken to having a noisy fan in my room to drown out the noises in white noise. Long term that's bad for my hearing, but at least I can sleep until my alarm goes off.<br><br>Noise is, as you can tell, a major problem here. I have upstairs neighbors that aren't helping the situation (who vacuums at 1am?) but that doesn't forgive the complex for cheap construction and other irritating noise factors. How about not mowing the lawn at 8 in the morning? Its just one more thing the fan drowns out.<br><br>Oh, and those gates? During my time here at least one of the gates is broken sometime during every week. It got so bad a that until a few weeks ago they had them all locked open for about two months. Also, they bought the cheapest possible gate system. These aren't even close to security gates. About 5 cars can get through before they close. People sit by the gates and drive in the out gates to get in. Useless for security purposes, so what, pray tell, are they for? It would be better were they removed.<br><br>What else...Oh yeah. The appliances are the cheapest I've ever had. The refridgerator is noisy when running, at least it does stay cold. Too bad it doesn't have any shelves in the freezer. Set at a coldness level of 6/10 my vegetable drawer regularly gets below freezing. Set warmer and it doesn't keep everything properly chilled.<br><br>Build quality in this apartment is abysmal. The floors creak when you walk around, which, given the noise problems, is annoying for the folks downstairs I imagine. The hearth is crooked, as is the fire place (but in the opposite direction). About half of the corners are substantially out of true. I can see light around my front door.<br><br>Remember that huge garage that I mentioned? It has one anemic 60 watt bulb. It feels like a cavern with just that. I installed some large flourescent fixtures and bulbs and now I can actually see. What I discovered when doing this? There's no breaker in my breaker box for any of the garage outlets or lights. Is this even legal? Or are my neighbors paying for that electricity?<br><br>The garage entrance is very narrow. I have about two inches on either side of my mirrors when driving in (granted I have a large vehicle). If you drive a truck or van I hope you have steady hands.<br><br>That computer nook I mentioned in the pros? Yeah, it doesn't have a cable outlet, and the cable company can't add one. Why does that matter? Well, you can't put your cable modem there with your computer...I guess you need either a wireless network or to find a way to run a cable to your computer. I ran the wire underneath my carpet, but I'm betting most people won't be able to manage that.<br><br>Garbage disposal? Well, in theory. Just don't actually try it. Low volume toilets? I was excited to move into these apartments becuase I thought I was getting a good apartment. The staff has been friendly and maintenance has been great, but I am constantly finding that we aren't getting what we were promised. First, we have to pay the water bill. Supposedly it is to encourage water conservation. That is a load of bull. Greystar just wants to make more money. Second, we can't use our storage unit because of the hot water heater. What do they expect us to do with the items that we were told to we could store in there? Third, the pool is often dirty because of all of the debris that comes from the arbor. Fourth, the playground is in awful shape. Now I see why they drive you by it and point on their tour. One of the swings has been broken forever, and there is no mulch. It is dangerous for children. There are rocks, gravel, and dirt everywhere. Fifth, the gate always seems to be broken because when it breaks they wait forever to repair it. The staff has been very friendly, but the amenities are not up to par.

2005 - 2006 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/18/2006
Sometimes you have to be inconvenienced to experience improvements. I did not like the changes any more than anyone else, but now that I have seen MANY improvements, I understand the small inconveniences that had to be experienced to reach an end result. So I had to park on the street one day, the parking lot looks great. So they took away the alarm system, the place is like Fort Knox with security gates for parking lots and walking trails. Every complex I called now charges for water and sewer, Edinborough is following the trend. I feel Cynthia is doing a great job and has made many improvements. I love the new gutters and the new paint job looks great! Thet are always willing to spray the apartment when asked and they are cleaning my carpet because I signed a new lease. I do not think the walls are thin, actually the quietest apartment I have ever lived and I love all of my neighbors. For the price and the square footage, I feel like I definately get my money's worth. All I can say is if you hate it so much do not let the door hit you on the way out!

Report
Resident
2006 - 2007 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/15/2006
I have lived here about 1.5 years. I am one of the people that was relocated from the condemned building. While it was of course upsetting, they treated everyone from the building quite well. They paid for movers to relocate us to new units and gave us free upgrades to bigger apartments (we went from a 2 to 3 bedroom with no change in price). They also paid for our hotel stay and meals until we were able to move and gave us a 1.5 months free rent for our inconvenience. While the original apartment builder shouldn't have crammed one more building onto that steep hillside, I recognize that Greystar did not build these properties and they did their best with the situation. I don't often have problems with noise from neighboring apartments (I've only heard the neighbor's alarm clock once and occasionally the people above us make enough noise that we hear them). The problem area is the stairway, where everyones' conversations and footsteps on the cheap wooden stairs can be clearly heard from inside. Where I do have a problem with my neighbors is how inconsiderate and rude some of them are. The neighbors directly above us drop their cigarette butts and other debris onto our porch and into the shrubs. The people in our building leave trash outside our door, ranging from french fries to an apple core, more cigarette butts, etc. The mail service here is not very good. I frequently get my neighbors' mail in my box. While I make an effort to get mail to the right people, I have never received mail from any of my neighbors and I find it hard to believe that all of my mail is really getting to me. Some of the neighbors leave other people's mail in the mail center which I always check, just in case it's for me. I think that's a lazy and rude cop-out on the part of the neighbors here, who cannot be bothered to act the least bit neighborly. Also, twice I have received package notifications, only to go to the office and the person in the office tells me she doesn't see a package for me and they must have put a package notification in my mailbox by mistake. Somehow I doubt it, but they always basically say unless you can prove a package was sent to you that day, they're not going to make any effort to find your lost mail or admit that a package ever existed. There is ample parking here, in my opinion, for all the cars in the lot. The problem is that a bunch of the people think they have to park on the sidewalk instead of walking a little further to use the open spots. Actually, they park on the sidewalk right next to open spots, which is even more annoying. The lot is windy and narrow with poor visibility as it is, and they just make it worse. I also had my stereo and some of my things stolen out of my car last year, so make sure you always lock your doors and take anything you value inside or hide it out of view. The lease terms are quite awful. If you break the lease, you owe the rent for the rest of the term, as well as the so-called discount rate you have been receiving for the entire lease term. So if they claim that you had been paying $100 a month more than the apartment is worth, you owe them an extra $100 for every month you've already been in the lease. ALWAYS ASK TO READ THE LEASE TERMS BEFORE YOU DECIDE TO MOVE INTO AN APARTMENT. I learned my lesson and I don't want other people to get stuck in the same situation. The gates are open more than they are closed, so they are just a nuisance for the short periods of time when they are open. They are more of a decorative feature than a security feature. The floor plan is nice enough and the office staff is pretty nice too. As RTP apartments go, this place is pretty cheap and it's right off 40, which is nice. While I do have a lot of complaints, I'm pretty happy here in general. I've learned a lot of things to look out for next time I look for apartment (as soon as my lease is up here).

2005 - 2006 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/13/2006
I've been a resident since May, 2005. I agree with the other comments about the new management and pricing increases, not to mention the stupid gates...they should save everyone money and just get rid of them. And yes, the walls are thin; thankfully, I have pretty quiet neighbors. I will say that the office staff and maintenance staff are usually friendly. However, I would definitely move elsewhere. I have had major mouse problems over the past month; last night I TRAPPED 7 MICE IN UNDER 12 HOURS for a total of 10 MICE IN A MONTH (and no, I am not a slob)...read on for more info. I will be moving in August & now can't wait to leave. I am disgusted, and I don't get the heebie jeebies about mice...I work with them at my job, so I'd say I'm more at ease with them than your average Joe. I have pasted the body of a letter sent to the leasing office with more details about the severe mouse problem:<br>This letter is a follow-up of the meeting I had on June 13th, 2006 with [name deleted; manager] regarding a mouse problem in my apartment. I discussed with [name deleted; manager] that on the evening of June 12th through the morning hours of June 13th, 2006 over a time period of less than 12 hours, I trapped and killed seven mice in my kitchen. All of these mice were caught with traps I purchased and placed in my kitchen. In my opinion, many of these mice appeared to be juveniles, likely not over thirty days old. Six of the seven mice were caught by traps placed under the broiler of the oven. One mouse was caught in a trap between the cabinets and the refrigerator. From June 9th-11th two mice were trapped in this same trap. Also, the week before, a mouse was trapped behind the oven. To date, a total of ten mice have been trapped; one of these mice was caught a stick trap provided by Edinborough At The Park. The remaining nine mice were caught with traps I purchased. <br>To the best of my memory, I initially contacted the leasing office the week May 15th after I found mouse excrement and other evidence of mice in my pantry and stovetop. I believe records should be on file regarding further maintenance and maintenance requests concerning this issue. At one point, before the first mouse was trapped, I asked if maintenance had any other traps for my apartment because I believed the traps placed by maintenance were not effective. At this time, I was told that the complex was out of traps; therefore, I purchased traps myself. I contacted the leasing office on June 12th, 2006 to request that maintenance check the oven because I believed mice were living and possibly breeding in the insulation. I received a notice that evening that more traps were placed in the apartment (two behind the oven) and that the oven was checked. As I have stated above, that same evening I trapped and killed six mice in the broiler area of the oven. Because I did not realize until very recently that the oven insulation was a source of infestation, I have been using this oven over the past month. I hope it is needless to say that this discovery was appalling. <br>I requested that the oven be removed from my apartment and was informed this afternoon that this has been completed. I have also requested a concession on my rent for one month. I received a concession of $100.00 plus the cost of the traps on my June rent for this issue. As I discussed with [name deleted; manager], I am willing to pay $100.00 for my July rent; this will equal a total concession of one month's rent. I feel this is a reasonable concession considering not only the time I have spent dealing with this problem and the kitchen items and food I have had destroyed or contaminated, but also the sizeable health concern it presents.<br>That's the end of the letter to the management...by the way, my dog found and killed another mouse in the apartment last night...now the total is up to 11 mice this month. <br>Now, to their credit, the manager did offer that I could move into another apartment after I met with her this afternoon and presented seven dead, bloodied mice in a ziploc...yeah, it was pretty gross, but sometimes you have just have to get your point across. Since I am planning on leaving in August anyway, I don't really want that inconvenience of moving twice in under three months. I'd rather have the new oven and rent concession. RENTER BEWARE...demand to know if the unit you would be moving into has ever had mouse problems! Update: the leasing office did meet my requests: a new oven installed the day I confronted management and I received the rent concession I requested. Haven't seen more mice in about 3 weeks...maybe because of the new cat.

The remaining nine mice were caught with traps I purchased. <br>To the best of my memory, I initially contacted the leasing office the week May 15th after I found mouse excrement and other evidence of mice in my pantry and stovetop. I believe records should be on file regarding further maintenance and maintenance requests concerning this issue. At one point, before the first mouse was trapped, I asked if maintenance had any other traps for my apartment because I believed the traps placed by maintenance were not effective. At this time, I was told that the complex was out of traps; therefore, I purchased traps myself. I contacted the leasing office on June 12th, 2006 to request that maintenance check the oven because I believed mice were living and possibly breeding in the insulation. I received a notice that evening that more traps were placed in the apartment (two behind the oven) and that the oven was checked. As I have stated above, that same evening I trapped and killed six mice in the broiler area of the oven. Because I did not realize until very recently that the oven insulation was a source of infestation, I have been using this oven over the past month. I hope it is needless to say that this discovery was appalling. <br>I requested that the oven be removed from my apartment and was informed this afternoon that this has been completed. I have also requested a concession on my rent for one month. I received a concession of $100.00 plus the cost of the traps on my June rent for this issue. As I discussed with [name deleted; manager], I am willing to pay $100.00 for my July rent; this will equal a total concession of one month's rent. I feel this is a reasonable concession considering not only the time I have spent dealing with this problem and the kitchen items and food I have had destroyed or contaminated, but also the sizeable health concern it presents.<br>That's the end of the letter to the management...by the way, my dog found and killed another mouse in the apartment last night...now the total is up to 11 mice this month. <br>Now, to their credit, the manager did offer that I could move into another apartment after I met with her this afternoon and presented seven dead, bloodied mice in a ziploc...yeah, it was pretty gross, but sometimes you have just have to get your point across. Since I am planning on leaving in August anyway, I don't really want that inconvenience of moving twice in under three months. I'd rather have the new oven and rent concession. RENTER BEWARE...demand to know if the unit you would be moving into has ever had mouse problems! Update: the leasing office did meet my requests: a new oven installed the day I confronted management and I received the rent concession I requested. Haven't seen more mice in about 3 weeks...maybe because of the new cat. Read less

Resident
2003 - 2004 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/01/2004
I have been living in this apartment complex for a little more than a year, and I've been very satisfied with my experience. My apartment overlooks the wetlands, so the view is incredible...I get to watch all kinds of creatures down below, such as deer, beavers, turtles, ducks, geese, herons, and hawks. Also, the birdfeeders on my balcony draw numerous mourning doves and hummingbirds, which provide endless entertainment for my cat. <br><br>My apartment is very quiet...at night, all I hear are the crickets and frogs down in the wetlands. Although the apartment community is close to the highway, I can rarely ever hear the traffic noise. I almost never hear my neighbors.<br><br>The apartment grounds are nicely landscaped and well-kept. I have a third-story apartment and have never had any problems with bugs. Maintenance has always been prompt and friendly. The office staff are also very friendly and helpful.<br><br>Despite the often non-working gates, I've always felt safe. Parking, at least on the Beaver Dam Run side, seems more than ample.<br>This apartment complex offers a number of amenities that are rare in other communities, such as free pet-sitting and an indoor pool. Given the number of amenities and the size of my apartment, I think the rental price is very reasonable. Having been exposed to rental fees in other large cities, I've learned that apartments such as this one can run for two to three times (!) what I'm paying currently, so it's important to recognize the great cost of living we have here in the Triangle.<br><br>The location is good, in the sense that it's centrally located between Raleigh, Cary, Durham, and Chapel Hill. However, one of the few drawbacks of the apartment complex deals with its location...whereas there is a lot of hustle and bustle in RTP during the workweek, the area becomes pretty "dead" and lonesome during nights and weekends, so there are few options for dining, shopping, or nightlife in the immediate vicinity. Also, Miami Blvd. is not an ideal street for a leisurely walk, so you pretty much have to get in your car and drive to a greenway to do that. Nevertheless, the Brier Creek shopping area and Southpoint Mall are each about ten minutes away, and if you work in RTP, you will have a very short commute.<br><br>I've read a number of very scathing reviews on this website and although I realize everyone's experience will be different, some people have been overly harsh in their criticism. For instance, I believe maintenance do their job on a daily basis in cleaning the fitness center and mailbox areas, but I think it's unrealistic to expect them to spend their time constantly picking up after lazy and inconsiderate residents who drip buckets of sweat all over the exercise equipment or who throw their junk mail on the ground rather than carry it to the garbage can. Also, they are constantly having to fix the gates because ignorant residents keep running into them! <br><br>Overall, I'm very pleased with this apartment complex and would recommend it to anyone moving to the area.

Resident
2003 - 2004 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/21/2004
I've really enjoyed staying here. I don't think you can beat the location, as you're less than 10 minutes from South Point mall in Durham and Briar Creek shopping center in Raleigh. Parking in the Beaver Dam Run side isn't a problem, but the Edinborough side looks like it gets pretty bad at times. The staff is very friendly. I'm in a 3rd floor apartment, so the noise isn't really a problem, although you do occasionally hear the apartment next to or below you. I get the impression that they're bad about raising the rent when you're lease is up, because people are always moving in/out. Overall, I would recommend these apartments, and plan on staying after my lease is up as long as the price remains reasonable. <br> <br>Oh, one complaint, the parking gate. Apparently, they claim it's not a "security" gate but a "limited access" gate. It's often broken, and can get very loud and annoying if you live in an apartment next to it.

2004 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/30/2004
Apartment construction was really terrible. Drywall seams are easy to find. My apartment had knife marks in it. Water heater doesn't work well at all, on maximum setting it is barely hot enough to be comfortable for a shower. Refrigerator runs all of the time, they told me I had to clean it myself. Coils are on the bottom and hard to reach. Power bill was way too high. Air Conditioning compressors on ground levels make it very, very loud for residents of the first and even the 2nd floor. <br> <br>Extermination is inadequate. They came in to exterminate my apartment for bugs twice and sprayed/applied/dusted all of ZERO times. The contractor they use for extermination is pathetic. I found bugs in my toilet when i arrived. Cracks in tile floors, cracks in walls, ceilings, tub, counters, moulding. Carpets were in bad condition for the asking price. <br> <br>Management will tell you they left a note on your door about something and when you tell them you never recieved it they tell you a note was left on your door repeatedly. Management is very strict about leaving items outside for pickup by delivery companies. They take your items and throw them away. When you call them they tell you nothing can be left out. I ended up having to pay a big fee because they threw away reusable moving boxes. <br> <br>If you do choose to move into this dump be sure that you are very, very, picky and detailed about damages to the apartment. If you don't do this within three days you pay to restore the condition of the apartment to its origional state. <br> <br>The workout room is nasty and dirty. The equipment is grungy and dirty with sweat and dirt. The AC in the workout room is usually set too high making for an uncomfortable workout. <br> <br>Pools get very dirty because they aren't cleaned very often. The dirt accumulates for about a week or two until it finally gets cleaned. <br> <br>The gas bbqs near the pool are nice, however they don't have their own self ignition, bring matches. <br> <br>Free cookies and lemonaid are provided in the office most days. Thats pretty nice, but i don't think they want residents to eat them. <br> <br>Smoke damage in units because they don't seam to care if people smoke in the units. Although my unit was pretty clean there was dirt and stuff in the corners. Some units have smoke damage because they allow smoking. <br> <br>The grounds are picked up pretty well, they have a maintenance guy who works hard at it. However he smells of cig. smoke when he enters and you can tell for hours because the smell is left behind. <br> <br>The Internet access is pretty good for RoadRunner/TimeWarner Internet users. It was reported to me that they have their own dedicated cable modem segmentation of the RR network. <br> <br>TV connection outlets are pleanty in some units and non pleanty in other units. I had two, one in my hallway and one in a bedroom. <br> <br>Included Alarm requires phone number in order to use it. If staff enters the unit they turn the alarm off and don't turn it on. <br> <br>Bugs.. I've developed a number of spider bites as a result of staying at Edinborough for only a few weeks. Despite two extermination attempts. <br> <br>Miniblinds, they jam quite often but generally its nothing permanate. <br> <br>Newspaper delivery is pretty annoying, the carrier just throws it anywhere and more often than not it ends up in front of your unit. <br> <br>The wetlands near the units mean that there are more insects and bugs. From time to time there is a big wasps nest that forms near the units. They are okay at removing those. If you're allergic to any kind of bee sting stay away from this place. <br> <br>The Recycling is inadequate. It does not comply with regulations. They do not provide recycling for steel, tin, or plastics. Recycling/garbage is inconvienent for most of the residents. Garbage in the compactor really stinks and is unpleasant. <br> <br>Outdoor showers near pool do not get hot at all, just forget about using them. Indoor bathrooms in club house are mostly clean but shower was always nasty. Black mildew grew on the plastic seals and shower had hair, soap scum, chips, cracks, and leaks. Indoor bathroom has insect problem. <br> <br>Tap water in units is almost always warm, when hot water heater isn't working well they are the same temperature from time to time. <br> <br>Move in condition required several repairs and fixes. They did vacuum and do something to the counters ahead of time however I had to put in repair requests right away. <br> <br>Mail area is not accessable for most tenants since its so far away from some buildings. There is usually a pile of junk mail strewn about near the mail area. <br> <br>Workout/Pool/Club house is too far away from most of the units in the complex. Quite a few tenants drive to the club house, mail box, or garbage. <br> <br>The foot gate near the club house was broken when i moved in and remained so. Anyone could drive up and walk thru the gate. <br> <br>Community is not bicycle friendly, no where to lock bikes up outside besides decks above first floors. A bike won't make the gate open so you have to walk up the stairs with it to get out of the complex. The back gate does not have a call box so guests must come to front gate. Fee for losing access card to gate is $25.00. Actual cost to replace the RFID card, around $2 (June 2004 Price). Give you one key to the apartment, its got corrosion on it. <br> <br>Decks/Padios are always full of bugs, spiders, ants, beetles. <br> <br>After a few weeks I went from grateful and encouraged to feeling like i'm being ripped off. The appeal of this place wears off very, very quickly. <br> <br>Has two TVs in workout room, one has fuzzy picture, other is okay. Usually on different channels and volume up too high. <br> <br>That little room in the club house goes for $200/night. Don't go into it thinking that you can use it when you like, they lock it up when they close. They also have a computer and a meeting room, those too are locked up when they close the office. <br> <br>Parking is sometimes really good and sometimes really scarse. They rent garages for extra $$ every month. I've seen a towing company a few times. One time they were chasing a car whose owner discovered they were about to be towed. There are quite a few handicaped spaces in some units. They are almost never used. Leaves from the trees get on your car and make it look bad. The speed limit is nice, but no one follows it. They need speed bumps and more dead ends. <br> <br>Built in fireplace is gas only. Not even worth turning on. Its cheap and some units the fireplace is missing pieces. Also not cleaned when I moved in. <br> <br>Dishwasher is cheap, sometimes you have to run it two or three times to get dishes that were prewashed by hand completely rinsed. <br> <br>They rent a Washer/Dryer for $40/mo if you want them. Not really a bad thing there. <br> <br>Avoid groundlevel units (noise, bugs). <br>Avoid 3rd story units (heat, walk). <br>Avoid 2nd story units (noice, bugs, walk). <br> <br>Or beter yet, avoid Edinborough at the Park <br> <br>This community is very transient from what I can tell. Residents don't usually stay long. At these prices and with these conditions who would?

Resident
2004 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/06/2004
I've lived in here for a year now. My fiance lived here before as have a few of our friends. <br>We moved in here this time because we got in on a promotion. Our rent is very reasonable right now. However, we are looking for a house to buy and our lease is up in a couple of months (they require 2 months notice to leave). We wanted to go month to month but our rent would have doubled. The only way we could afford to stay is if we signed an 8 month lease. So we are stuck here for another 8 months. (it would have been too much trouble and too costly to move anywhere else right now). This is a time when I've seen apartments here stay empty for 6 months or more. Considering the fact that we have been really good tenants more than once and they are having a hard time keeping their apartments filled, it seems they could have worked with us. <br>The maintenance staff always came the same day we called. Sometimes they had to come back more than once, but they were always nice (but a bit smelly). <br>I don't see the luxury. The workout room is full of equiptment that doesn't really work properly, and most of them work the same muscle group. The eliptical machine is really sad. <br>I have pets and like the fact that they are pet friendly, but they don't enforce the pet rules. There is poop every where. I always poopy scoop, it angers me that other pet owners are not as responsible. There is supposed to be a fine for not scooping, but it's never enforced. <br>The plumbing noises are horrible. And if I'm in the bathroom I can hear every word that is said in the bathroom/bedroom above me. <br>So, if you can get in on a deal, (and you know you won't have to break your lease), you don't expect luxury, you don't mind open gates, and you don't mind poop, then this place is a good place to live. It's much better than other places I've lived. <br>I've never seen a roach!!

1999 - 2002 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/23/2003
After reading several other reviews, I feel I must amend my own review. <br> <br><br>I looked at these apartments while they were being built (the original phase off Chin Page) and I know the construction quality is good, at least. Lived at Edinboroug for three years in a 1245 sq ft fantastic apartment with a giant garage (450 sq ft). I never had much of a problem with noise. The worst I ever experienced in my second floor apt. was one couple who lived above me and then only when they had visitors. It wasn´t bad, just noticeable. <br><br>Facilities were excellent. I moved the first year they painted the grass, but I think the whole thing is silly. Why not give that extra money back to the residents? Price was very expensive (I was paying $1145 when I moved). <br><br>Office staff was generally good (particularly Angel), though the management company was beyond strict (I was one day late with my last payment - after three years of on time payments! - and they tacked on an extra $50 and would only accept a cashier´s check). I don´t really blame the office staff for that as they have to follow the rules of the management company. Maintenance staff was generally timely and fixed most problems the first time (save for my flooding garage that took two years to repair), though again they were very strict about the grounds being cleared AT ALL TIMES of all objects (I set two plants out in front of my garage one day to get some rain and they were discarded within the hour). Pray you don´t have to break your lease though because it´ll cost you two months´ rent. <br><br>You might think that after living there for three years, I´d have more to say. Not really... pretty much the only reason I moved was because it was so expensive. I now have a house that´s twice as big for $100 less/month. <br> <br><br>I somewhat hesitate to recommend Edinborough, though overall they are better than they are worse. I recommend it based on the quality of the apartments and facilities and the staff, not because of the management company or the few problems they encounter (like that perpetual gate issues).

2002 - 2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/23/2003
I don´t understand how people can be so cruel as I have read the ratings on this site. So, I would like people to know both sides. As with any place you will there is good and there is bad. However, with the bad, if I have not done my part to address the issues then I have no right to complain about it. In my review, let me express the good and the unfortunates during MY experience at Edinborough at the Park. Remember, this is MY opinion and should not reflect what yours should be. <br>First, there was a problem with roudy kids outside screaming and acting like a bunch of "hoodlums" and caused damage to my vehicle. I addressed this issue with the management and within 24 hours a VERY STRONG warning memo went out to the residents and this problem ceased IMMEDIATELY. This made me feel very important as a resident living here. Anytime my husband and I have expressed concerns about gates being left open, maintenance issues, ...etc, the management team took these concerns seriously and cared to rectify these matters immediately. <br>I am very offended that anyone could have had anything negative to say about Angel Brown. Let me strongly express that Angel has ALWAYS conducted herself in an extremely professional manner and has made my family feel top notch important here. She is one of the main reasons that we have decided to renew our lease. Then, we have recently found out that she would no longer be here and already disappointments have started. As I have never been late for my rent we have asked upper management (from another office temporarily taking over) to assist us as we would like to upgrade to a bigger apartment and since they do not know my family they were of no help. That is unfortunate. I would have felt taken care of if only Angel would stay on board! However, this will be upper administration´s loss that they did not do everything in their power to keep her. Luckily, there is still Meg and Jeff. <br>Except for the extremely HIGH prices, don´t let anyone´s horrific comments scare you away. I am a strong critic and I have decided to give Edinborough at the Part another year!

2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/02/2003
When I first came to look at the place, I waited a LOOONG time. The office was busy with tenants coming in and out and the phones ringing. I was asked to wait a few times, and started to feel ignored and unimportant. My impression changed, though, when the leasing agent finally sat down and said, <br> <br><br><br>"Sorry about that-- we always keep our current residents as our top priority." <br> <br><br><br>As he walked around the clubhouse and pool, I was struck by how well the leasing agent/office staff knew the other residents. He called them by name, asked about their kids, and asked if there were any problems in the apartments. I was also impressed by the various floorplans, services, location, and pricing of all the different units. This commitment to their residents was evident that day, and has continued to be since I moved in. <br> <br><br>I´m really happy. Parking seems to be fine near my apartment, my utility bills are really good (because of the gas appliances), the few maintenance things that have popped up were fixed within a day, and the noise from other apartments is minor at best. <br> <br><br>I was bummed when I found out their free Pet-sitting Service didn´t apply to my dog (but it would apply if i had cats or birds or even plants to be watered). I was, however, very impressed when I pointed out the absence of a dog-walking station (with trash bags) near my apartment-- and saw one installed within a month. <br> <br><br>Yeah, from what I´ve seen since I moved in a few months ago, this place is a good place to live, and my neighbors all seem happy, too. It´s too bad people are more apt to complain than to praise a good thing. Move in!

Resident
2001 - 2002 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/28/2002
Apartment: Build very solid and have never had any problems with unfixed problems. We had a small water leak that was fixed 45 minutes after we called and they called back a few days later to double check to make sure that everything was okay. We never hear any of our neighbors except occationally when someone hurries up the stairs. Great layout, lots of windows and a great view over looking the wetlands. <br> <br>Parking: Never had a problem with parking... coming back home late some nights I´ve had to park in front of the next building but anyone who says that they have had to park further than that is on something synthetic or else just crying about having to walk the extra 50 feet... gimme a break! <br> <br>Grounds: Great! In the winter they use food coloring to make the front lawn green as part of their "The grass is always greener..." promotion, pretty funny I think. I checked and it´s totally enviromentally sound... it´s the same stuff you use in christmas cookies. <br> <br>Safety: Superb! I´ve never felt the slightest bit uncomfortable walking my dog at night even on the nature trail! Granted... the gates are broken about 30% of the time (Always because of the 2 or 3 idiotic residents who by some miricle have drivers licenses, blindly piling their cars through a painful obvious 8 foot high heavy black gate, somehow forgetting that it has been there every single day since the day they moved in (Morons on Parade... bring your video camera and an address to "America´s Worst Drivers"))! This place isn´t in a bad area by any means so even walking around outside the gate has never made me nervous. Another great plus is free monitored alarm systems! Never had a problem with mine other than it can interfer with DSL. Then all you have to do is have Verison put a splitter on your phone line (free of charge) and the problem disapears. <br> <br>Management: The best I have ever encountered! Angel, Jeff and CJ are among nicest people I´ve ever met. If you are the type of person who leaves bags of trash outside your door, throws junk mail in the parking lot, doesn´t pay rent on time, hits the gates (i.e. one of the 2 or 3 morons mentioned above) or do anything else that is destructive or disruptive then you won´t like them. They follow the rules and don´t play favorites. If you break the rules they will catch you, or someone else on property will turn you in but if you are a generally decent person who doesn´t blast his sterio so loud that the next building can hear it or squawk your tires in the parking lot when you think no one is watching then I promise you´ll love them. The staff takes care of pets while you are away, waters plants and even holds packages for you if you´re not home when they are delivered! They hold several parties every year for all the residents and are simply, just fun to be around. I´ve never had to remind them of my name on any visit to the office. I truely feel like "part of the family" here! They know who I am, where I live and have always taken care of me, my needs and my pets. <br> <br>The only bad things with this property are (1) it can be hard to get out onto Miami Blvd in the mornings but I´ve never had to wait more than a minute or two and (2) there isn´t a dog walking station on one side but not the other. <br> <br>Anyone who can find something wrong with this property has a severe case of "Princess and the Pea" syndrom! I feel sorry that they can´t see how great this place - and the people who work here - really are.
