Resident
2002 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/01/2002
Good: The apartments are beautiful. Most of the neighbors are friendly. Free alarm systems are included. Two outdoor pools, one indoor pool. Nice workout facility. Beautiful landscaping. <br> <br>Neutral: Location of shopping. There are two Food Lions nearby, and a Lowe´s and Kroger once you get to Cary. It´s a little inconvenient, but not as bad as some of the other reviews might have you believe. Convenient to I-40, though the worst part of I-40! <br> <br>Bad: 50% of what I was promised when I was shown the apartment was not true, from the hours of the pool to the availability of dish tv, to whether maintenance would help me install my washer and dryer, not to mention the amount I was told to bring for move in suddenly went up when I showed up to get my keys! The construction is horrible. I hear my neighbors´ stereos, their toilets and showers, etc. My phone lines haven´t worked since I moved in and they will not take responsibility for the poor wiring. Maintenance, while nice, are exceedingly slow to respond. Rental rates are random - a duplicate floor plan in the community costs a neighbor $150 more a month than what I pay. The security gates are closed and properly functioning only about 1/2 of the time. Right now, neither of the two closed circuit cameras on the gates are working. The laundry rooms are inconvenient, the dryers take two runs to get a load dry and you can´t use quarters - you have to recharge a prepaid card at the office, during office hours! First floor apartments are crawling with pesty bugs like spiders. There are some disrespectful neighbors (littering in your own parking lot -- how classless!) but you risk that anywhere. The office management (like Angel) is quite possibly the rudest person I´ve ever met, though the leasing consultant Jeff is nice. Pathetic recycling facilities. Inconvenient garbage collection. Water pressure in the shower is poor unless you modify their water-saving shower heads. <br> <br>Overall: More bad than good. There are better places to live for the money Edinborough charges.

The construction is horrible. I hear my neighbors´ stereos, their toilets and showers, etc. My phone lines haven´t worked since I moved in and they will not take responsibility for the poor wiring. Maintenance, while nice, are exceedingly slow to respond. Rental rates are random - a duplicate floor plan in the community costs a neighbor $150 more a month than what I pay. The security gates are closed and properly functioning only about 1/2 of the time. Right now, neither of the two closed circuit cameras on the gates are working. The laundry rooms are inconvenient, the dryers take two runs to get a load dry and you can´t use quarters - you have to recharge a prepaid card at the office, during office hours! First floor apartments are crawling with pesty bugs like spiders. There are some disrespectful neighbors (littering in your own parking lot -- how classless!) but you risk that anywhere. The office management (like Angel) is quite possibly the rudest person I´ve ever met, though the leasing consultant Jeff is nice. Pathetic recycling facilities. Inconvenient garbage collection. Water pressure in the shower is poor unless you modify their water-saving shower heads. <br> <br>Overall: More bad than good. There are better places to live for the money Edinborough charges. Read less

Resident
1999 - 2002 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/01/2002
I have lived here from nearly the beginning. I have read the reviews from past residents and feel that they are most unjust. The office staff go out of their way to look after the residents and always give excellent service. If I have any service requests, they are dealt with efficiently and generally within 24 hours if not the same day. They even change my light bulbs!Parking can be a problem anywhere, and there are very few problems. I have never had a problem and neither have my neighbors. Location is GREAT! Within 15 minutes I can be at any of the major shopping malls and the new mall is just 5 minutes away. Grocery shopping is 5 minutes away. I am close to work and feel sorry for those who have to commute. We have 3 swimming pools which are open 24 hours, fitness centre is great, everything is always clean and tidy. They even supply us with towels. There is a complimentary airport shuttle, which I use a lot. The property overlooks the protected wetlands and is very peaceful and tranquil. They have gas on the property. My utility bills combined have never been more than $40. My rent went down on my last renewal, as did everyone elses that I spoke with! They look after their residents and give them the best possible deal. There are a lot of residents who have been there from the beginning. We wouldn´t stay if we didn´t like it, or weren´t treated properly! As for safety, they provide us FREE with monitored intrusion alarms. If you are stupid enough not to use it, so be it. There has never been a shooting on the property nor any crime of violence. There has never been a crime problem on the property. Trash and other recycling services are free. They provide a good constant service on trash removal. Another thing I like, if I have any concerns, the staff attend to my needs in a timely, efficient manner. They make me feel as a respected and valued resident. When I am away, they offer a free pet sitting service, and my pet is always well looked after. My houseplants are also water. And this is a FREE service. The staff have all been with the property for at least 2 years, and I really like the consistancy of service. I can highly recommend where I live, and I am looking forward to staying here for a long time. <br>A Very Happy Resident Who Is One Of Most!

Report
Resident
1999 - 2002 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/11/2002
The apartments are nice, but they are way overpriced, and the rent increases much more than we expected ($950 to $1080- 14% increase). It was very convenient for me to get to work, but very inconvenient to everything else, including grocery stores, shopping, and pretty much everything else. With the new mall coming in, shopping will be close by, but I suspect traffic will be pretty bad once that mall is completed. The parking situation at the apt. was horrible at times- there are just not enough spaces. Sometimes I would have to park 5 or 6 buildings away, which was a pain particularly after grocery shopping. Residents with 2-car driveways/garages that only park one car there and park the other in the open spaces create some of this problem, and an overabundance of handicapped spaces doesn´t help (not to be un-PC, but 8 out of the 12 spaces next to my building are designated as handicapped spaces, and no handicapped resident lives in my entire building). Many residents park in these handicapped spaces anyway. The mailboxes and trash receptacles aren´t very convenient either, unless you live in one of the few adjacent buildings near one of the two. The recycling opportunities are poor. The clubhouse has relatively nice facilities, but my roommate found the weightroom quite limiting (no free weights). There is an indoor lap pool and an outdoor pool, both of which are nice features. The landscaping is average, although they have the bizarre practice of painting the grass green. I found this to be somewhat dismaying and environmentally unsound.

Leasing

Edinborough at the Park is currently showing spacious one, two and three bedroom apartments in Durham, NC. Our gorgeous community comes with two seasonal outdoor pools that include a sundeck and lounge chairs. During the colder seasons, you can take advantage of the heated indoor lap pool. The twenty-four-hour fitness center offers state-of-the-art equipment such as weight-lifting machines and treadmills, while our outdoor tennis court allows you to enjoy a friendly game with your neighbors. Each one of our apartments comes with an equipped kitchen complete with a breakfast bar, refrigerator and a stove to help you prepare delicious meals. The gorgeous wood-style cabinets offer you plenty of space to store your groceries and kitchen utensils. Enter the spacious living area where all floor plans offer plenty of room to watch television and unwind above rich carpeted flooring. Each bedroom comes with plenty of closet space for your clothing and other personal belongings. Sunrooms and ...

Management Company: Greystar*
